intro: Cacalia, commonly known as the blueweed, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers that typically range in color from white to blue or purple. Cacalia species are native to various regions in Europe, Asia, and North America, often growing in moist, open habitats. They have alternate, lance-shaped leaves and produce small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
